body_html:
After investigation found that, "int64" value on x86 is "unsigned" by default whereas on ppc64le it is "signed" by default, that is why this test was failing on ppc64le.

To make the results compatible with x86, some code changes were required on ppc64le.
After code changes, I ran this test and now it is passing on ppc64le as well as on X86.

Code changes submitted for review in PR #10522 to fix this.
Once approved I will push the changes to Github so PR #10522 should resolve this.

After investigation found that, "int64" value on x86 is "unsigned" by default whereas on ppc64le it is "signed" by default, that is why this test was failing on ppc64le.
To make the results compatible with x86, some code changes were required on ppc64le.
After code changes, I ran this test and now it is passing on ppc64le as well as on X86.
Code changes submitted for review in PR #10522  to fix this.
Once approved I will push the changes to Github so PR #10522 should resolve this.
body:
After investigation found that, "int64" value on x86 is "unsigned" by default whereas on ppc64le it is "signed" by default, that is why this test was failing on ppc64le.

To make the results compatible with x86, some code changes were required on ppc64le.
After code changes, I ran this test and now it is passing on ppc64le as well as on X86.

Code changes submitted for review in PR https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10522  to fix this.
Once approved I will push the changes to Github so PR https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10522 should resolve this.
